properties.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Oxford; Southern Coos
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 8 at 2:34PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
At 233 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line
extending from 6 miles west of Mount Washington to 6 miles northeast
of Lincoln...and moving southeast AT 30 MPH.

Locations impacted include...
Conway, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Franconia, Carroll, Bartlett, Madison,
Jackson, Albany, Chatham, Hart's Location, Sugar Hill, Whitefield and
Livermore.

This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 109 and 117.

This also includes...
Crawford Notch State Park, Franconia Notch, Cannon Mountain, North
Twin Mountain, and Franconia Ridge.

* Visibilities will drop quickly to near a quarter mile at times
in the area of heavy snow showers.

Travel is not advised during these heavy snow showers. Rapid
visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to
accidents. Consider delaying travel until the snow showers pass your
location. If traveling pull off to a safe location.

NWSheadline: An area of heavy snow showers will affect southwestern Coos... northeastern Grafton and northeastern Carroll Counties
